p.seg: On peut dire qu'il savait être ministre. [Third role as a minister.]
Ainsi, qu'une même personne connût trois changements durant sa vie
Ainsi, qu'une même personne connût trois changements durant sa vie. [三"in three ways" is not here three times as the English has it, nor is this simply a matter of three changes as the French

Ainsi, qu'une même personne connût trois changements durant sa vie. [三"in three ways" is not here three times as the English has it, nor is this simply a matter of three changes as the French. 陳廣忠fares no better: 这样一人之身经三次变化，

Ainsi, qu'une même personne connût trois changements durant sa vie. [三"in three ways" is not here three times as the English has it, nor is this simply a matter of three changes as the French. 陳廣忠fares no better: 这样一人之身经三次变化， 劉康德：所以周公一人前后三次改变身份和为人作风
Il n'y eut chez lui aucune volonté s'arroger un pouvoir discrétionnaire,

Ainsi, qu'une même personne connût trois changements durant sa vie. [三"in three ways" is not here three times as the English has it, nor is this simply a matter of three changes as the French. 陳廣忠fares no better: 这样一人之身经三次变化， 劉康德：所以周公一人前后三次改变身份和为人作风 許匡一：周公一个人前后三次改变身份和为人态度，
correspondait aux exigences de circonstances différentes. [§§§§所以"is the means whereby" is mistranslated "in order to". The French is also imprecise at this point.]
correspondait aux exigences de circonstances différentes. [§§§§所以"this is the means whereby" is mistranslated "in order to". The French is also imprecise on this point.]

À combien plus de changements sont astreints un prince qui utilise plusieurs codes de lois, [楊樹達云:「世」字無義，字當作「法」，字. But "rulers among whom there are frequent changes of new generations" does seem to make sense. 待考]
pour assouvir leur amour et leur haine. [§§§好憎"positive or negative desires" is not rendered well by "wishes".]
et des lois applicables à une circonstance donnée, [高注：一行之禮，非隨時禮也。一定之法，非隨時

...qui désire répondre aux époques différentes et épouser les changements... [§§§§§時偶變"the contingent changes of the times" that notion of "contingency" is philosophically crucial and omitted in the English.]
ne pourra manifestement pas atteindre un juste équilibre. [中權 is difficult also in Lunyu, to which this refers. I do not see where both the French and the English get their "equilibrium".]
... manifestement.. [§§§亦明矣"is surely clear!" the "surely" is important and imrecognised in the English.]

On appelle dao ce qui est à l'origine du saint. [§§§§§所由 is not 所從"what he follows", but "where he comes from, where he has his source from which his sagehood flows. The point is profound and nowhere addressed in the English.
on appelle "affaire" ce qu'il accomplit. [§所為"what he works at" is neither what he does nor what he accomplishes.]
on appelle "affaire" ce qu'il accomplit. [§所為"what he works at". §事 "tasks; projects; undertakings" are not activities. The French "affaires" gets much close to the sense of the word. ]
on appelle "affaire" ce qu'il accomplit. [§所為"what he works at". §事 "tasks; projects; undertakings" are not activities. The French "affaires" gets much close to the sense of the word. 許匡一：具体做的叫做事。 ]

on appelle "affaire" ce qu'il accomplit. [§所為"what he works at". §事 "tasks; projects; undertakings" are not activities. The French "affaires" gets much close to the sense of the word. 許匡一 as many other Chinese translators offers no explicit clarification of what 事 means, as he impeccably translates 事 as 事：具体做的叫做事。 ]
Le dao est comme la chloche et le phonolithe:
on accorde leur son une fois, il ne varie plus. [§§§§一調不更"once it is tuned, one does not retune them" and the transitive semantics of 更 is important for the line of argument.]

on peut modifier le son de chaque corde. [§§§§§每終"Whenever an undertaking is finished" one retunes one's strategic "instrument" put to use in action 事. No "need" is mentioned in the Chinese, and 終 is not addressed in the French or the English. 陳廣忠 does get it: 曲终都可以改文声调。But he fortuitously adds "can" which is not good for the logic of the argument.]
sont des instruments pour the gouvernement. [治之具"instruments for governance" in the English is much better than the French "instruments for the government".]

Ils ne sont pas ce à partir de quoi l'on gouverne. [所以為治"the means by which one conducts government", the reason why one carries out government is in order to benefit the people one governs. 陳廣忠 misreads this as being about the purpose of government: 是统治人民的工具，而不是作为治理的目的。高注 sees the problem of philosophical interpretation and offers an explanation：言法制禮義，可以為治之基耳，非所以為治，治在其人之德，猶弓矢射之具也，非能必中也，中在其人之巧。"law, regulations, ritual, and rightness are the basis on which to conduct government, that is all, but they are not that by means of which one conducts government, for this government hinges on the (governing) person's potency. It is like the bow and the arrow being instruments for shooting, but they do not have the capacity to invariably hit the target. The hitting of the target is a matter of the ingenuity of a man. " (I follow the problematic 高注 text as in Zhang Shuangdi p. 1385]
C'est pourquoi, si l'on prend la vertu d'humanité comme chaîne [§§§§§以為"consider as, treat as" is misread in the English.]
elles ne s'altéreront pas même dans dix mille générations. [§者"is something that" is not recognised.]
Mais s'il s'agit d'évaluer le talent des hommes [人考其才"If on on the other hand in the case of a man who investigates his talents
et d'examiner périodiquement l'accomplissement de leurs tâches, ["and over time monitors his use (of these talents),“]
et d'examiner périodiquement l'accomplissement de leurs tâches, ["and at the appropriate times monitors his use (of these talents),“]
on peut alors s'attendre à des changements même quotidiens. [§§§§§雖日變可也"even if he has changed all the time, that/he is acceptable" does not come across in the English.]

Où donc trouverait-on des lois constantes dans le monde? [(Given that changing so much such a person would still be acceptable) how could there be one unchanging model to follow in this world?" 高注 sees the need for an explanation of the argument here：言人能考度其才，時省其行，擇其善者而崇用之，不必循常，故曰「雖日變可也」。唯仁義不可改耳，故[曰]萬世不更矣。 Chen Guangzhong seems superior to all the Westerners on this passage: "至于像用人考核他的才能，而按时察看他们的政绩，即使说每天有新的变化也是可以的，天下难道有什么固定不变的常规吗？同社会时事相合，符合人的常理，顺应天地的变化，对鬼神和顺，那么就能得到整治了。”

Où donc trouverait-on des lois constantes dans le monde? [§§§§§§豈 "howsoever?" makes rhetorical questions, and the English fails to bring out this absolutely crucial point. "(Given that so much change would still be acceptable) how could there be one unchanging model to follow in this world?" 高注 sees the need for an explanation of the argument here：言人能考度其才，時省其行，擇其善者而崇用之，不必循常，故曰「雖日變可也」。唯仁義不可改耳，故[曰]萬世不更矣。 Chen Guangzhong seems superior to all the Westerners on this passage: "至于像用人考核他的才能，而按时察看他们的政绩，即使说每天有新的变化也是可以的，天下难道有什么固定不变的常规吗？同社会时事相合，符合人的常理，顺应天地的变化，对鬼神和顺，那么就能得到整治了。”
où l'on respecte les mânes et les esprits, [§§祥"be in auspicious accord with" does not seem to involve any concept of happiness, as suggested in the English translation."
Il n'y eut chez lui aucune volonté s'arroger un pouvoir discrétionnaire, §志 is "ambition", not will.
aucune apparence de vouloir s'attribuer la mérite de ses actions. [§§§伐矜“bragging, boasting, bluster" is subtly different from pride.]

correspondait aux exigences de circonstances différentes. [§§§§所以"this is the means whereby" is mistranslated "in order to". The French is also imprecise on this point. 許匡一 has no problems with this and keeps very close to the original: 这是为了顺应时势啊。]

À combien plus de changements sont astreints un prince qui utilise plusieurs codes de lois, [§§§The English makes no sense and seems unaware of 楊樹達云:「世」字無義，字當作「法」，字. 許匡一 follows 楊樹達：何况同一位君王多次改变治国之法 as does the French.]
Généralement, les hommes profitent de leur position
ils mettent leur autorité et leur puissance au service de leurs convoitises et de leurs désirs.
Généralement, les hommes profitent de leur position [§以其位 "in accordance with their social position, as their social position allows them to" is perhaps preferable.]
Or, qui désire répondre aux époques différentes et épouser les changements en adoptant des rites valables pour une conduite donnée,
et des lois applicables à une circonstance donnée, [高注：一行之禮，非隨時禮也。一定之法，非隨時法

on peut modifier le son de chaque corde. [§§§§§每終"Whenever an undertaking is finished" one retunes the "instrument". No "need" is mentioned in the Chinese, and 終 is not addressed in the French or the English. 陳廣忠 does get it: 曲终都可以改文声调。But 陳廣忠 fortuitously adds "can" which is not needed for the logic of the argument.]

Mais s'il s'agit d'évaluer le talent des hommes [人考其才"If on on the other hand in the case of a man who investigates his talents" is misconstrued as a comparison, when in fact what we have is a conditional phrase.

Mais s'il s'agit d'évaluer le talent des hommes [人考其才"If on the other hand in the case of a man who investigates his talents" is misconstrued as a comparison, when in fact what we have is a conditional phrase.
et d'examiner périodiquement l'accomplissement de leurs tâches, [時省其用 "and at the appropriate times monitors his use (of these talents),“]

Où donc trouverait-on des lois constantes dans le monde? [§§§§§§豈 "howsoever?" makes rhetorical questions, and the English fails to bring out this absolutely crucial point. 天下豈有常法哉！"(Given that so much change would still be acceptable) how could there be one unchanging model to follow in this world?" 高注 sees the need for an explanation of the argument here：言人能考度其才，時省其行，擇其善者而崇用之，不必循常，故曰「雖日變可也」。唯仁義不可改耳，故[曰]萬世不更矣。 Chen Guangzhong seems superior to all the Westerners on this passage: "至于像用人考核他的才能，而按时察看他们的政绩，即使说每天有新的变化也是可以的，天下难道有什么固定不变的常规吗？同社会时事相合，符合人的常理，顺应天地的变化，对鬼神和顺，那么就能得到整治了。”
où l'on pénètre la raison humaine,
Dans lAntiquité, les hommes étaient simples, les artisans fiables,， 厖: 厚实。《道藏》本作“ 庞＂。
Dans lAntiquité, les hommes étaient simples, les artisans fiables,，[§§§§厖"reliable" not "skillful" as the English has it. 厖: 厚实。《道藏》本作“ 庞＂。
et les coutumes du peuple s'affadirent graduellement. [§§§薄"the traditional customs are more and more weakened". The English "stingy" seems to go nowhere.]
un peuple enténébré, [§§弊"beclouded" seems to have nothing to do with "corruption" as is suggested in the English.]
c'est comme monter un cheval fougeux sans utiliser ni mors ni cravache. [§§§馯"ferocious" is too important to be omitted. 御馬"drive horses" is not quite the same as controlling horses.]
Tang [Yao] et Yu [Shun] utilisèrent des règles et des ordonnances, mai ne recoururent ni aux châtiments ni aux exécutions.
Sous les Xia, la parole nétait jamais reniée. [§§負言"break one's promise, go back on one's word" is idiomatic. False words are not the issue. This is about promises.]
les gens tolèrent les insultes et traîtent les outrages avec légèreté; [§訽"be sworn at" makes this less repetitive and is probably to be preferred.
Si l'on prétendait se servir du dao de Shennong pour les gouverner, [The subjunctive is helpful.]
Now, those
se limitaient à l'arc et l'épée,
la lance en bois n'avait pas de lame, [§§§§柔"soft>wooden" is not addressed in the English.高注：無鐵刃也。]
la lance en bois n'avait pas de lame, [§§§§高注：無鐵刃也。]
la lance en bois n'avait pas de lame, [§§§§无擊"had no iron blade" is different from "sharp points". 高注：無鐵刃也。]

et la douve et les paravents pour la défensive. [§§§§渠"moat" being unproblematic, the provenance of the "spiked balls" in the English seems unclear. 陳廣忠：渠帷(qu chan) ：高诱注有两义：其一指护城河。其二指盾牌和护甲。据《墨子·备城门》载“ 渠＂、＂渠答“义， 当为一种守城设备。]
Ce qui était justice dans l'Antiquité [§§§§為"be deemed" is not recognised in the English and the French. Pomeranceva gets the essential point right in Russian: То, что в древности считалось честью,]
est devenu honteux dans les temps modernes. [§§§§§所以為辱"that by means of which one is deemed disgraceful" is grammatically seriously misconstrued by the French and the English.
Ce qui était glorieux dans l'Antiquité [§§§§§所以為榮"that by means of which one is deemed glorious" is grammatically seriously misconstrued by the French and the English.]

L'ordre de lAantiquité [§§§§§所以為治"that by means of which one is deemed well-governed" is grammatically seriously misconstrued by the French and the English. 陳廣忠 addresses the 所以 but has a different take: 古代所用来治理国家的办法，"...that by means of which one governs the state"

Shun n'eut qu'à [exécuter une danse] avec le bouclier dans une main et la hache de guerre dans l'autre pour soumettre les Youmiao. [§§§執干戚“picking up a shield and a hatchet (in a symbolic gesture)" is crucial for an understanding of this passage. The English does not bring the point across and a footnote is needed. For details on the Shun episode see He Ning 130

Shun n'eut qu'à [exécuter une danse] avec le bouclier dans une main et la hache de guerre dans l'autre pour soumettre les Youmiao. [§執干戚“picking up a shield and a hatchet (in a symbolic gesture)" For details on this Shun episode see He Ning 130

Cependant, ceux qui lancent des expéditions militaires de nos jours ne peuvent contrôler la violence s'ils abandonnent leur armures et leurs armes. [§§§§§§釋"discard" is mistranslated as "use": as a result the English makes no sense. 陳廣忠 has no problem with this, unsurprisingly: 然而当今的征伐者不能放弃武器而制服强暴。]

sont ce par quoi on légitime les coutumes du peuple et jauge le dégré d'urgence des affaires. [§§§§緩急"relative non-urgency and urgency (of undertakings)"論“fix officially" or something like this seems necessary for the argument here. (Yang Shuda finds it necessary to emend the text on this point. One understands why he felt uneasy with this 論.) 陳廣忠 tries to handle the difficult 論民俗"legally fix what is popularly conventional" by a gloss that is hard to fit into the argumentative context：法令制度，是用来明辨民间习俗节制缓急的； The point that law merely codifies given popular conventions is crucial for the philosophy of law in the Huainanzi. "Assessing customs of the people" does not seem to me to fit the argumentative context.

changent au gré des époques et permettent de façonner des objects adaptés aux besoins [§§§制宜適:The English seems to fail to address the syntax of this tricky patch. I suggest: "As for such "tools" one changes them in response to (changing) times and produces well-adapted ones."陳廣忠 comes close, but I find him not sufficiently explicit：器械物用，也是要依照时势变化而制造适宜合适的产品。]

Le saint crée les lois et le peuple inculte est réglée par elles; [§萬物 is what all premodern editions have, and what is found problematic by many here：Following Liu Wendian (approved on this by Yang Shuda) the English emends this to 萬民 and translates accordingly. This would have needed a textual footnote. The French follows Yang Shuda all the way to reading 愚民 and adds a surprisingly misleading footnote: Les editions modernes lisent fautivement soit "dix mille êtres, soit "dix mille peuples", au lieu de peuple inculte."]
ne peut s'élever bien haut; [The English reads 與 here as 以, but not so 陳廣忠：被法制制服的百姓，不能够和他远游高举 who manages beautifully to bring across the spirit of this line.

ne peuvent répondre aux changements. [§§§§不可使 “cannot be ordered to" is not rendered in the English. Again, 陳廣忠 has no problem with this 使：被礼俗拘泥之人，不能够使他适应变化。Neither has Pomeranceva: не заставишь отвечать на изменения.]
On ne peut exiger d'une oreille inapte à distinguer l'aigu du grave [§§§§§§耳 "(someone who) with his ears..." is adverbial. The subject of 知 is not the ear, but the person with such an ear.

qu'elle accorde des sons. [§§§§§不可令"cannot be made to" is misconstrued in the English. 陳廣忠has no problem: 耳朵不能够分辨清浊之声的人，不能够让他来调整音律；Pomeranceva is interestingly more precise on the first part than the English: Тот, чье ухо не различает чистых и мутных звуков "those whose eye does not distinguish...".]

On ne peut exiger d'une oreille inapte à distinguer l'aigu du grave [§§§§§§耳 "(someone who) with his ears..." is adverbial. The subject of 知 is not the ear, but the person with such an ear. And "ears" cannot
on ne peut demander à un esprit incapable de connaître la source de l'ordre et du désordre [§§§§§心 is adverbial "(someone who) with his mind", the subject of 知 being a person, not a mind."

Seul celui qui entend ce que les autres n'entendent pas [§§§§§獨聞之聽"a independent way of listening (unique and independent of what others hear,) hears" is central to the argument . [陳廣忠 has it right：一定要有独特的听觉、
et voit ce que les autres ne voient pas [陳廣忠：特殊的视觉，
